name: clinker production | inert waste | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19488/documentation

The dataset describes the production of Portland cement clinker. Clinker is made by sintering a mixture composed mainly of limestone and clay at temperatures up to 1400 °C.;Primary fuels such as coal and natural gas are used along with alternative fuels are considered as a reference product (including used tyres, waste plastic, textiles, sludge, etc. ) and a waste (solid and inert waste). The dataset is mainly based on sustainability reports of three principal clinker producers of Colombia (Argos, Cemex and Holcim).

From the reception of traditional and alternative fuels and raw materials at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the cooling of the produced clinker. It includes the whole manufacturing process to produce clinker (raw material provision, grinding and mixing; rotary kiln process), internal processes (transport, etc.) and for the infrastructure only the rotary kiln (material consumption) is taken into account. No administration is included.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The production volume of 2016 is considered. Data from sustainability reports of 2014 to 2017 is used. Not all the data for all exchanges was available for the same year, consequently the time period covers several years (the latest available is used).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative clinker production in Colombia. Data based from main clinker producers.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset represents the current technology for clinker production in Colombia
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The life cycle inventory model is based on the PCR for cement and concrete(Environdec, 2010), as well as on the LCA core model of the WBCSD-CSI EPD tool (Dauriat et al., 2014). 
Air emissions (expect CO2, NOx and SO2) are modelled on literature values (Dauriat et al., 2014). The infrastructure, auxiliary materials, wastes are based on the global ecoinvent dataset for clinker production.

Standard basic uncertainty values were used.

Dauriat, A., Porté, C., Delerce, C., Guignard, C., & Adams, A. (2014). WBCSD CSI tool for EPDs of concrete and cement: LCA core model and database report.

Environdec. (2010). Product category rules of UN CPC 3744 Cement.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The data is compiled based on different data sources, including sustainability reports, literature values and expert judgements. Most data is derived from sustainability reports of the three principal clinker producers of Colombia (Argos, Cemex and Holcim). The data is checked, completed and validated by local experts. In total, it is estimated that the data considered is representative for 81% of clinker production in all the country (market share of the three main clinker producers).
Unit flows were calculated by dividing the amounts of inputs and outputs by the total clinker production in mass.
The amount of the exchanges were calculated considering the arithmetic/weighted average of the sample. No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other Ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Information was provided for the total energy consumption for clinker production for Colombia in 2012. The information is based on statistics of all Colombian producers in TJ (terajoules). The clinker production in 2012 was 8.7 Mt (Ministerio de Minas y Energia, 2017). According to ASOCRETO five percent of the energy was provided by secondary fuels. Since the share of the different secondary fuels is not provided we’ve used the weighted average of the data published by Argos, Holcim and Cemex, which represents 81% of the market share. The LHV are taken from  (Dauriat et al., 2014)

Dauriat, A., Porté, C., Delerce, C., Guignard, C., & Adams, A. (2014). WBCSD CSI tool for EPDs of concrete and cement: LCA core model and database report.
